result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Skipper Johnson, Victim 1, or Victim 1's residence.
Release conditions: Defendant is to be transported to ARC House in Madison, WI by her Parole Agent or a Transport Sergeant on 10/27/22.  Defendant must comply with treatment conditions and remain substance free, failure to do so will result in revocation of the Signature Bond and returning the Defendant to the Jackson County Jail.
Sent signature bond over to the JCJ to Sgt. Johnson.

12:58 PM Defendant Ashley E. Foth appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Signature bond needs to be sent over with release conditions.

Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PARTIES MAY APPEAR AT THE HEARING IN PERSON OR BY VIDEO OR PHONE USING ZOOM UNLESS ORDERED OTHERWISE BY THE COURT. 

To Join By Video:
Copy and paste the following link into your web browser: https://wicourts.zoom.us/j/82280183059
Enter Meeting ID: 822 8018 3059

To Join By Telephone:
Call the following number: 312-626-6799
Enter Meeting ID: 822 8018 3059

Note: To appear by video, you will need a web camera and microphone connected to your computer. If you do not have a microphone connected to your computer, follow the directions to appear by phone.  If you have been unable to join the Zoom meeting by the time scheduled, please call 715-670-0514 immediately so the court has notice and can assist you.
9:20 AM Defendant Ashley E. Foth appeared by video, in custody from JCJ.  Attorney Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Still waiting for counsel AIA set for 11/21 @ 9 am.

9:21 AM Defendant Ashley E. Foth appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. State addresses conditions. If transportation is set, court will order a signature bond with conditions to comply w/treatment conditions.

ADDRESS INFO for Ashley E. Foth
Current: 24304 Flint Ave, Tomah, WI 54660 United States  (Effective: 10-17-2022)
Prior: 412 E. 2nd Street, Black River Falls, WI 54615
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Skipper Johnson, Victim 1, or Victim 1's residence.

Cash bond remains until defendant is released to Arc House in Madison 10/27/22 and is to be transferred to facility by a Jail Personal or Probation Agent.

11:28 AM Defendant Ashley E. Foth appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Crystal Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  She understood.  Court explained her attorney rights. Attorney Sebion confirmed defendant qualifies for SPD still looking for counsel, had assisted defendant set up for a bond hearing to request a signature bond so that she can go to treatment next week.  Defendant updates she is to be sent to Arc House in Madison a bed is to be available next week or by 10/27, the SGT from the jail or probation to be transporting her.  Updated address 24304 Flint Ave, Tomah WI 54660. Txt  715-492-2912.  Court a cash bond is appropriate but due to the treatment becoming available orders the cash bond remains in effect until she is released to a jail personal or probation agent who is able to transfer her to Arc House in Madison and then it would be converted to a signature bond with same conditions. Attorney Sebion will contact defendant's probation agent and have them file a letter that will have more detail.
